fast3d.util.serial

Class BinaryReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.serial.BinaryReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VecBinaryReader

    public class BinaryReader
extends java.lang.Object
    a simple way of reading complex primitive information out of a binary stream
    the backing stream needs to be opened and closed separately - this instance can just be collected by the JVM garbage collector
    every IO-Exception will be caught and it's stack trace is printed
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryReader(java.io.InputStream stream)
      constructs a reader deserializing from the data read out of the stream

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] read(int length)
      reads a plain byte-array from the stream
      double[] readDouble(int amount)
      reads amount doubles from the stream
      float[] readFloat(int amount)
      reads amount floats from the stream
      int[] readInt(int amount)
      reads amount integers from the stream
      long[] readLong(int amount)
      reads amount longs from the stream
      java.lang.String readString()
      reads an integer from the stream and then calls readString(length) with length being the read integer
      java.lang.String readString(int length)
      reads an array of bytes with the specified length from the stream and deserializes it based on the UTF-8 encoding

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public byte[] read(int length)
        reads a plain byte-array from the stream
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the array to read
        Returns:
        the read array or null if reading failed (even if it failed partly)

      • readInt

        public int[] readInt(int amount)
        reads amount integers from the stream
        Parameters:
        amount - the count of integers to read
        Returns:
        an array of the primitives read from the stream or null if reading or deserialization failed (even partly)

      • readLong

        public long[] readLong(int amount)
        reads amount longs from the stream
        Parameters:
        amount - the count of longs to read
        Returns:
        an array of the primitives read from the stream or null if reading or deserialization failed (even partly)

      • readDouble

        public double[] readDouble(int amount)
        reads amount doubles from the stream
        Parameters:
        amount - the count of doubles to read
        Returns:
        an array of the primitives read from the stream or null if reading or deserialization failed (even partly)

      • readFloat

        public float[] readFloat(int amount)
        reads amount floats from the stream
        Parameters:
        amount - the count of floats to read
        Returns:
        an array of the primitives read from the stream or null if reading or deserialization failed (even partly)

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(int length)
        reads an array of bytes with the specified length from the stream and deserializes it based on the UTF-8 encoding
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the bytes-array of the string
        Returns:
        the deserialized string or null if something went wrong
        See Also:
        readString()

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
        reads an integer from the stream and then calls readString(length) with length being the read integer
        Returns:
        the deserialized string or null if something went wrong
        See Also:
        readString(int)
